name: Andy Grove
background: Intel CEO who transformed it from memory to microprocessors. Hungarian refugee, engineer, management thinker. Wrote 'High Output Management' and 'Only the Paranoid Survive'.

principles.name: Only the paranoid survive
principles.description: Strategic inflection points can make or break companies overnight. Constant vigilance for 10X changes is required. By the time a threat is obvious, it's too late to respond.
principles.falsification: When paranoia causes over-reaction to false threats and premature abandonment of working strategies

principles.name: Let chaos reign, then rein in chaos
principles.description: In times of strategic uncertainty, encourage experimentation and debate. But once direction is clear, demand unified execution. Endless debate is as bad as premature commitment.
principles.falsification: When early commitment and consistent execution beat delayed but unified action

principles.name: A manager's output is the output of their organization
principles.description: You're not measured by your individual work but by your team's results. Leverage your time by improving team effectiveness. High-leverage activities multiply your impact.
principles.falsification: When individual contributor work genuinely has higher impact than management activities
